author: Sandra Alvarado

review: I pre-ordered my Fire TV Stick the day they were announced on Amazon. The first couple of months I had it it was awesome. I began using it exclusively over my other streaming devices. I love it.Now that I've had it a couple of months, it's really gone downhill. It freezes and lags constantly. Every single time I try to watch something on Hulu or Netflix the video will freeze and the audio will keep going. It never unfreezes. I've tried every suggestion I can find online. Clearing the cache, moving the router closer, having it plugged into the wall, deleting apps, fastforwarding/rewinding, and more. None of it fixes the issue for more than 5 minutes.I would not suggest buying one. They really do seem great for the first couple of months, but there is something seriously wonky with mine now. And, after doing a google search of my problem, it appears that I'm not the only one.

review: Got this as a gift for Father's Day and while I haven't had a ton of time to spend exploring it, I'm pleased with what it offers me as a Prime member. I've watched a movie (playback was excellent with no pauses for buffering or noticeably image quality issues) and when my toddler wanted a specific Mickey Mouse Clubhouse episode, I was able to find it. I think my one complaint is that it can be a bit clunky to navigate through menus and searching things by name is a bit of a chore. I really like being able to use my phone or iPad as additional remotes, however.

review: We love this!!  It's easy to install and we haven't had any issues with it.  We use this on whichever tv that does not have a device hooked up to it at that time, meaning that it's great that this is so portable!  We are Prime users so this is a great advantage to us as we Prime apps and products all the time.  There are also a variety of apps that we can use so it's not like we are "stuck" on using only Amazon apps or products (which we don't mind).  I would definitely buy this as a gift or even for myself if we needed it for another tv.
author: Jamie

review: Meaty fingers, had a hard time opening the remote. Dropped it and the door popped off. For some reason got an error that USB power was insufficient. Had it plugged into a power strip. Plugged it into a wall outlet and no error. Plugged it back into the power strip and no error. Now that it's working, I LOVE IT. Watching Netflix now, Star Trek Into Darkness, I wanted to test picture and sound. I couldn't be happier. Looking forward to downloading the APP on my smartphone so I can use it to voice search and type. Remote is just fine for now.Most importantly, the device is connected 100% to wifi, a full signal. Goodby Roku!
